entry.title: pagereveal should be dispatched for iframes on BFCache restore
entry.content:
Copying over from the discussion here: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5318099/comment/e0aca860_9d1d1a33/. pagereveal should be dispatched for iframes that are restored from BFCache.
This means that this logic needs to traverse the frame tree: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/exported/web_view_impl.cc;l=2569;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090

entry.title: CHECK failure: false. ADDRESS:LayoutText #text in element_inner_text.cc
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=5077338659684352
Fuzzer: inferno_twister Job Type: linux_lsan_chrome_mp Platform Id: linux
Crash Type: CHECK failure Crash Address: Crash State: false. ADDRESS:LayoutText #text in element_inner_text.cc
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)
Crash Revision: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=linux_lsan_chrome_mp&revision=1264944
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=5077338659684352
Issue filed automatically.
To reproduce this, please build the target in this report and run it against the reproducer testcase. Please use the GN arguments provided at bottom of this report when building the binary.
If you have trouble reproducing, please also export the environment variables listed under "[Environment]" in the crash stacktrace.
If you have any feedback on reproducing test cases, let us know at https://forms.gle/Yh3qCYFveHj6E5jz5 so we can improve.
************************* UNREPRODUCIBLE ************************* Note: This crash might not be reproducible with the provided testcase. That said, for the past 14 days, we've been seeing this crash frequently.
It may be possible to reproduce by trying the following options: - Run testcase multiple times for a longer duration. - Run fuzzing without testcase argument to hit the same crash signature.
If it still does not reproduce, try a speculative fix based on the crash stacktrace and verify if it works by looking at the crash statistics in the report. We will auto-close the bug if the crash is not seen for 14 days. ******************************************************************

Sanitizer: memory (MSAN)
Regressed: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=libfuzzer_chrome_msan&range=1228430:1228437

Issue filed automatically.
See https://www.chromium.org/developers/testing/memorysanitizer#TOC-Reproducing-ClusterFuzz-Bugs for instructions on reproducing this bug locally.

entry.title: SkiaGraphite feature should only be checked via IsSkiaGraphiteEnabled()
entry.content:
IsSkiaGraphiteSupportedByDevice() is structured to check `IsSkiaGraphiteSupportedByDevice()` before checking if `features::kSkiaGraphite` is enabled. This is to remove devices that can't support graphite from the finch study since they never check if the feature is enabled.
That is not working as expected because [this](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/gpu/compositor_util.cc;l=227;drc=67db7ae4803bbf0ff439ee264dcfc23650e75aa8) unconditionally checks the feature status. I think that is why ~60% of the Mac/Intel experiment group is [still running Ganesh/GL](https://uma.googleplex.com/p/chrome/variations?sid=652a679566c36c546c86c57c0007fcd5).

entry.title: [WebView] More Robust UI Styling and Themes
entry.content:
Currently WebView is quite limited in the ability to inherit UI styles and themes from the embedding application. We should design and implement a system to handle this. The system should do the following:
1. Inherit set styles and themes from the embedding application where applicable (e.g. Dialog text size & color). 2. Fallback to default Android styling (using AOSP attributes) if the application hasn't set all needed attributes.

# Additional Data Category: JavaScript \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Microsoft SSO not properly working on Chromium-based browsers, Constant authentication required.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Sign into Company M365 account 2. go to myapplications.microsoft.com and authenticate 3. click on any myapplications tile. The tile should automatically authenticate since you have authenticated before. 4. Instead, username/password and MFA code is needed each time that you open a tile. 5. 50% of the time, the webpage does not load and you need to reload it 4-5 times.
Troubleshooting done: 1. reset all browser data (all time) 2. Full re-install of Chrome (including all local data, and removing all Google related folders on the C drive and sub-directories) 3. Tried on VPN and non VPN
# Problem Description The problem consists of multiple authentications to Microsoft and browser running at a slow pace. In a normal scenario, you would only have to authenticate one time at the beginning of an 8-hour period as it would cache your login. Each subsequent SSO application that you navigated should automatically log you in and authenticate you. Instead, what is happening, is that each time you open another SSO application, you must enter your username/password/MFA code again each time you open the same or different applications. Nothing has changed in our MS tenant that would cause this to break, as it works fine on Firefox, Brave, and other non-chromium based browsers. Using Edge (which is chromium based) helps the issue slightly, but it still does not work. the speed issues are also an issue, it takes 1+ minute to load some of the SSO applications when it would take 10 seconds before, this does not happen with the same applications on a non-Chromium browser.
# Additional Comments We use Microsoft M365 Subscriptions for our users and have not had this problem in the past
# Summary Microsoft SSO not properly working on Chromium-based browsers, Constant authentication required.
# Custom Questions #### Example URL: anything Microsoft SSO
#### Does the problem occur on multiple sites? Yes - Please describe below
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chromium problem
# Additional Data Category: Content \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Please give Dart EngProd access to logs in chromecompute project
entry.content:
The startup logs for Windows VMs in Dart's LUCI swarming pool, in the dart-internal GCP project, are being sent to the chromecompute project, according to information from a chat.
We would like the dart-engprod group to be given log read access to the chromecompute project so we can see the startup logs.

entry.title: Lazily Initialize Tab Helpers That Aren't Needed At Startup
entry.content: Currently, all tab helpers are attached when a WebState is created which can lead to longer startup times especially for users with a high amount of tabs. To address this, we plan to create a new template class LazyWebStateUserData which will be used to replace WebStateUserData. Additionally, we will need to refactor tab helpers to use this new class.

entry.title: Trouble sharing a single non-chrome window
entry.content:
Chrome Version: ``` Google Chrome 122.0.6261.69 (Official Build) (64-bit) Revision 81bc525b6a36d91ed7fe98a4b53c6f53c79adbb2-refs/branch-heads/6261_57@{#3} OS Linux JavaScript V8 12.2.281.16 User Agent Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/122.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Command Line /usr/bin/google-chrome --enable-features=UseOzonePlatform --ozone-platform=wayland --flag-switches-begin --flag-switches-end --desktop-startup-id=5ba9b31b99eb86ad6eb38bc00868e141 ```
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) join a google meet meeting (2) click the present button (3) try to share a window (4) Attempt to share a non-browser window in google meet (ideally my terminal, alacritty)
What is the expected result? I can share the terminal
What happens instead? I tried sway, gnome 3 and kde plasma
### Sway * After selecting "window", no preview will display. * If you click in the area where the preview would normally display, it shows a preview of the entire screen. * the "choose a different window" button does not allow anything else but the entire screen appear. * note: this does actually allow me to share the entire screen. I just can't select a single window.
### Gnome 3 * After selecting "window", no preview will display. * If you click in the area where the preview would normally display, nothing ever happens * If you select the blank preview window and try to share, it does not share anything
### KDE Plasma My screen recording messed up so I will redo this step with more details. From memory: * This actually works. The window pops up after selecting "window" with actual previews of separate windows. * This did allow me to share, but something went wrong. The CPU usage looked so high I couldn't move the mouse cursor for several seconds. This might have messed up the screen recording.
I've attached dbus logs for each of these sessions. I have screen recordings in a drive folder. Please let me know if those are desired.

entry.title: Randomized-response calculations crash on maximal sources
entry.content:
On sufficiently large output states (the maximal case being a source with 20 reports, 32 trigger data values, and 5 report windows), a [multiplication in the `BinomialCoefficient` function](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/attribution_reporting/privacy_math.cc;l=296;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090) overflows an `int64_t`, causing a crash.
In other words, this function crashes when called as `BinomialCoefficient(180, 20)`.

entry.title: Omnibox height is too large
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Update Chrome from 114 to 115 or higher. 2. See this stupid new omnibox design that wastes so much vertical space! 3. Return it to the normal size before 2023 UI refresh.
# Problem Description The problem is that Chrome designers make stupid decisions about UI.
After Chroe 2023 UI refresh omnibox height increased once again! Now it wastes even more vertical space. i mean, THERE ARE MARGINS ABOVE AND UNDER THE TABS! WHY? JUST WHY? What is the purpose of this new design? Maybe it works okay for people using 32 inch monitors, but for others it looks like a very dumb change. Maybe think about people who use laptops? No? Please!
At lease make a switch to return the omnibox height to the same size (or smaller) it was before the UI refresh.
# Summary Omnibox height is too large
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Nvidia 4060 - framebuffers and yooutube-panorama videos are broken in Chrome-Vulkan.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 0. Nvidia 4060 RTX only, maybe it same on Nvidia 40XX series, I do not know, not tested 1. chrome.exe --use-angle=vulkan or /usr/bin/google-chrome-stable --use-angle=vulkan 2. to test framebuffer format - open https://www.shadertoy.com/view/WscyRM 3. to test video - open https://youtu.be/v8O2ZEeMiRE - video will be pixelated on 1080p+
Expected result on Shadertoy link is "23-bits" everywhere. On Youtube - video not pixelated.
# Problem Description I have tested/used Chrome in Vulkan mode on Nvidia 750, Nvidia 3080 - it work "as expected", buffers not 10-bits and youtube video work perfectly fine there. This current bug/problem - is only on 4060.
Outside of Chrome - I can play 60fps 4k videos with not even 10% of 4060 GPU utilisation - youtube pixelated is not GPU problem. Outside of Chrome - I use Vulkan and buffers there work perfectly fine - 32-bit buffers, no bug. Also - in OpenGL and in ANGLE DX11 on this 4060 GPU - no these bugs.
And since Chrome in Vulkan works fine in 3080 - I think this bug related to "Chrome GPU blacklist" or something similar in internal of GPU-render of Chrome.
# Additional Comments Screenshots of bugged result from 4060RTX in Chome in Vulkan:
# Summary Nvidia 4060 - framebuffers and yooutube-panorama videos are broken in Chrome-Vulkan.
# Custom Questions #### Example URL: https://www.shadertoy.com/view/WscyRM
#### Does the problem occur on multiple sites? Yes - Please describe below
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: Content \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Errors rethrown in wasm are not reported on `window.onerror` handler.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Commandline reproduction in V8 repository
Apply the following diff ``` diff --git a/test/message/fail/wasm-exception-rethrow.js b/test/message/fail/wasm-exception-rethrow.js index f7b17b32f19..86bd4ab9f57 100644 --- a/test/message/fail/wasm-exception-rethrow.js +++ b/test/message/fail/wasm-exception-rethrow.js @@ -5,15 +5,35 @@ d8.file.execute('test/mjsunit/wasm/wasm-module-builder.js');
let builder = new WasmModuleBuilder(); + +let kImports = { + XXX: { + foo: function (a) { + console.log(a); + try { throw 'aaa'; } catch (e) {} + }, + }, +}; + +let fooSig = makeSig([kWasmI32], []); +let fooIndex = builder.addImport('XXX', 'foo', fooSig); + let except = builder.addTag(kSig_v_i); builder.addFunction("rethrow0", kSig_v_v) .addBody([ kExprTry, kWasmVoid, kExprI32Const, 23, + + kExprI32Const, 0, + kExprCallFunction, fooIndex, + kExprThrow, except, kExprCatch, except, + kExprI32Const, 1, + kExprCallFunction, fooIndex, + kExprRethrow, 0, kExprEnd, ]).exportFunc(); -let instance = builder.instantiate(); +let instance = builder.instantiate(kImports); instance.exports.rethrow0(); ```
Run the test in D8: ``` % out/x64.release/d8 ./test/message/fail/wasm-exception-rethrow.js 0 1 ``` Without the `try { throw 'aaa'; } catch (e) {}` line we get instead the correct ``` % out/x64.release/d8 ./test/message/fail/wasm-exception-rethrow.js 0 1 undefined:0: [object WebAssembly.Exception] ```
2. For web: One can make a simple `index.html` with this content (in the v8 root git repo) ``` <!DOCTYPE html> <html> <head> </head> <body> <script src='test/mjsunit/wasm/wasm-module-builder.js'></script> <script type="text/javascript"> let builder = new WasmModuleBuilder();
let kImports = { XXX: { foo: function (a) { console.log(a); try { throw 'aaa'; } catch (e) {} }, }, };
let fooSig = makeSig([kWasmI32], []); let fooIndex = builder.addImport('XXX', 'foo', fooSig);
let except = builder.addTag(kSig_v_i); builder.addFunction("rethrow0", kSig_v_v) .addBody([ kExprTry, kWasmVoid, kExprI32Const, 23,
kExprI32Const, 0, kExprCallFunction, fooIndex,
kExprThrow, except, kExprCatch, except, kExprI32Const, 1, kExprCallFunction, fooIndex,
kExprRethrow, 0, kExprEnd, ]).exportFunc(); let instance = builder.instantiate(kImports); instance.exports.rethrow0(); </script> </body> </html> ```
Opening this in chrome will result in this console ``` 0 1 ```
Opening in firefox will result in this console ``` 0 1 [RED] Uncaught > WebAssembly.Exception ```
This is probably because the wasm `rethrow` assumes that `Isolate::pending_message` is valid from the catch until the rethrow. But this isn't necessarily true (above example prunes the pending message by adding a `try { throw '..'; } catch (e) {}`.
# Problem Description Errors are not correctly reported to `window.onerror` etc.
# Summary Errors rethrown in wasm are not reported on `window.onerror` handler.
# Additional Data Category: JavaScript \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Errors rethrown in wasm are not reported on `window.onerror` handler.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Commandline reproduction in V8 repository
Apply the following diff ``` diff --git a/test/message/fail/wasm-exception-rethrow.js b/test/message/fail/wasm-exception-rethrow.js index f7b17b32f19..86bd4ab9f57 100644 --- a/test/message/fail/wasm-exception-rethrow.js +++ b/test/message/fail/wasm-exception-rethrow.js @@ -5,15 +5,35 @@ d8.file.execute('test/mjsunit/wasm/wasm-module-builder.js');
let builder = new WasmModuleBuilder(); + +let kImports = { + XXX: { + foo: function (a) { + console.log(a); + try { throw 'aaa'; } catch (e) {} + }, + }, +}; + +let fooSig = makeSig([kWasmI32], []); +let fooIndex = builder.addImport('XXX', 'foo', fooSig); + let except = builder.addTag(kSig_v_i); builder.addFunction("rethrow0", kSig_v_v) .addBody([ kExprTry, kWasmVoid, kExprI32Const, 23, + + kExprI32Const, 0, + kExprCallFunction, fooIndex, + kExprThrow, except, kExprCatch, except, + kExprI32Const, 1, + kExprCallFunction, fooIndex, + kExprRethrow, 0, kExprEnd, ]).exportFunc(); -let instance = builder.instantiate(); +let instance = builder.instantiate(kImports); instance.exports.rethrow0(); ```
Run the test in D8: ``` % out/x64.release/d8 ./test/message/fail/wasm-exception-rethrow.js 0 1 ``` Without the `try { throw 'aaa'; } catch (e) {}` line we get instead the correct ``` % out/x64.release/d8 ./test/message/fail/wasm-exception-rethrow.js 0 1 undefined:0: [object WebAssembly.Exception] ```
2. For web: One can make a simple `index.html` with this content (in the v8 root git repo) ``` <!DOCTYPE html> <html> <head> </head> <body> <script src='test/mjsunit/wasm/wasm-module-builder.js'></script> <script type="text/javascript"> let builder = new WasmModuleBuilder();
let kImports = { XXX: { foo: function (a) { console.log(a); try { throw 'aaa'; } catch (e) {} }, }, };
let fooSig = makeSig([kWasmI32], []); let fooIndex = builder.addImport('XXX', 'foo', fooSig);
let except = builder.addTag(kSig_v_i); builder.addFunction("rethrow0", kSig_v_v) .addBody([ kExprTry, kWasmVoid, kExprI32Const, 23,
kExprI32Const, 0, kExprCallFunction, fooIndex,
kExprThrow, except, kExprCatch, except, kExprI32Const, 1, kExprCallFunction, fooIndex,
kExprRethrow, 0, kExprEnd, ]).exportFunc(); let instance = builder.instantiate(kImports); instance.exports.rethrow0(); </script> </body> </html> ```
Opening this in chrome will result in this console ``` 0 1 ```
Opening in firefox will result in this console ``` 0 1 [RED] Uncaught > WebAssembly.Exception ```
This is probably because the wasm `rethrow` assumes that `Isolate::pending_message` is valid from the catch until the rethrow. But this isn't necessarily true (above example prunes the pending message by adding a `try { throw '..'; } catch (e) {}`.
# Problem Description Errors are not correctly reported to `window.onerror` etc.
# Summary Errors rethrown in wasm are not reported on `window.onerror` handler.
# Additional Data Category: JavaScript \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Add tests for CreateGroup

The error reported in Chrome doesn't make sense.
And spec wise, why can't timeZoneName be used with other options?

entry.title: Inaccurate First-Install Counting
entry.content: ChromiumUpdater reporting of some first-installs is low; I suspect it is transmitting -2 instead of -1 for at least some installdate values.

entry.title:
Tests are failing: histogram_tester.cc(81): Expected equality of these values:
 expected_count
 Which is: 1
 actual_count
 Which is: 0
Histogram "PageLoad.Clien...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): histogram_tester.cc(81): Expected equality of these values:
 expected_count
 Which is: 1
 actual_count
 Which is: 0
Histogram "PageLoad.Clients.GoogleSearch.NavigationTiming.NavigationStartToFirstRequestStart" does not have the right number of samples (1) in the expected bucket (0). It has (0).
Histogram: PageLoad.Clients.GoogleSearch.NavigationTiming.NavigationStartToFirstRequestStart recorded 1 samples, mean = 10.0 (flags = 0x1)
0 O (0 = 0.0%)
10 -O (1 = 100.0%) {0.0%}
11 ... 

(expected at TestBody@chrome/browser/page_load_metrics/observers/gws_page_load_metrics_observer_unittest.cc:208)
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:unit_tests/GWSPageLoadMetricsObserverTest.SearchBackgroundLater - ninja://chrome/test:unit_tests/GWSPageLoadMetricsObserverTest.Search
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/9b7ae1f62cf489ee3387ed5055149354
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

What steps will reproduce the problem? (1)disable the blink feature "ScriptedSpeechRecognition" (2)compile with browser， install and run the brownser； (3)open multi-pages, pages cannot connect the internet.
What is the expected result? disable the blink feature "ScriptedSpeechRecognition" does not affect network connection.

entry.title: Back/Forward navigation in Heap Snapshots
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Navigate to https://codepen.io/web-dot-dev/live/PoLdbOX (this is a demo taken from https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/memory-problems/heap-snapshots) 2. Click "create scattered objects" once 3. Open up developer tools 4. Navigate to the "Memory" tab 5. Take a heap snapshot 6. In the constructors view, go to Item (which should have x20003 next to it) and expand this 7. Navigate quite a bit down to the 50th item and click this 8. In the retainers view right click "[50] in Array", then "reveal in summary view" 7. On the bottom in retainers right click one of the leaf nodes and select "Reveal In Summary View" 8. Ah we meant to click the "X in Item", it's awkward to go back to where we were.
This is a simplified reproduction, but in some larger projects where you can go quite deep in the retainers view, it can take you a while to get back to your previous position.
# Problem Description Investigating memory leaks is often a complex task: we frequently explore many avenues, expand numerous retainer trees and make use of the existing navigation features such as Reveal in summary view option.
However, if we find a dead end in our research or simply click something by mistake, it is difficult to recover the previous view. It would be very helpful if the heap snapshot browser allowed for back / forward navigation.
For example, if we use the Reveal in summary view option and then decide that this is not the object we are looking for, we have to manually go back to the previously viewed object and expand its retainer again.
# Additional Comments ## Gif The gif illustrates the issue where we look at the retainer for "FinalizationRegistry" and click "Reveal In Summary View". Once this action is taken we can't get back to our previous position to look further down the retainers tree for "FinalizationRegistry".
# Summary Back/Forward navigation in Heap Snapshots
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Improvements to search discoverability in Dev Tools (Performance Panel)
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open up developer tools 2. Navigate to the performance panel 3. Take a performance snapshot for a few seconds and stop 4. When looking at the results, try to search for a span without using ctrl + F
# Problem Description We have noticed some developers often don’t know they can search through the performance timeline, e.g. to find specific functions in the flame chart. This functionality is available through Ctrl + F shortcut, but it doesn’t seem to be advertised anywhere in the UI.
We think Chrome Developer Tools could improve this to make it clear that the users can search through the performance timeline.
The kebab menu in the top right corner does include a Search option, but this searches through the source files rather than the performance timeline.
# Summary Improvements to search discoverability in Dev Tools (Performance Panel)
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Non -Regression : Blocked sites are not getting added in Block list under Chrome://settings/content/sensors
entry.content:
Chrome Version: M121 Stable #121.0.6167.188/15699.66.0 - Crota(Brya) device
Lacros Version : LaCrOS Beta #123.0.6312.4
OS: Chrome
Issue Details: ------------------- 1)Accounts: Test account 2)Enterprise Enrolled: No, signed in with test account 3)Devices: A)Non-Corp devices Crota(Brya) - X86/Lacros64 4)Repro on Ash-chrome: Yes, able to repro on Ash 5)Mode: Verified 6)Frequency: Always 7)Enable the following flags from Ash Chrome (legacy) #lacros-stability = Beta #lacros-only = Enabled #lacros-availability-ignore = Enabled
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch Chrome 2. Go to chrome://settings/privacy 3. Tap on 'Site settings' 4. Tap on 'Motion sensors' 5. Select "Don't allow sites to use motion sensors" 6. Navigate to https://www.youtube.com/ 7. Make Motion sensors toggle ON 8. Reload page(Verify 'b') 9. Make Motion sensors toggle OFF 10. Reload page(Verify 'c')
What is the expected result? b. The site should be added in Allow list under Chrome://settings/content/sensors. c. The site should be added in Block list under Chrome://settings/content/sensors.
What happens instead? Instead sites are not getting added in Block list under Chrome://settings/content/sensors
Note: 1)Issue is able to repro in ash chrome 2) This Issue non-regression same seen on M111 #111.0.5563.152/15329.63.0 on Lava(Coral) device 3) Master Test tracker link: https://testtracker.googleplex.com/efforts/testcase/detail/472623902?tp_id=28921&result=&environment=

entry.title: ClusterFuzz pop-up menus include ever-increasing copies of each fuzzer
entry.content:
Do this:
1. Log into ClusterFuzz 2. Go to Fuzzer Stats 3. In the Fuzzer box, type `libyuv`
Expected behavior: See a list of `libfuzzer_libyuv_scale_fuzztest`, `libfuzzer_libyuv_scale_fuzzer`, `centipede_libyuv_scale_fuzztest`, `centipede_libyuv_scale_fuzzer`
Actual behavior: See lots of things like `centipede_centipede_centipede_centipede_libyuv_scale_fuzzer`
This is new in the past couple of days, I think, so I'm regarding this as P0 in case some job is currently creating these duplicate entries and we need to stop it fast! If that's not the case, this can obviously be downgraded. I've no idea if this is just a UI thing (in which case it's unimportant) or the core ClusterFuzz database is actually being corrupted in this way, but the same problem shows up in Crash Statistics.

Assigning to only listed owner, sky@, please route as appropriate.

entry.title: navigator.setAppBadge(2) doesn't work, but returns Promise instead of error.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. open https://tiona.de/ 2. install PWA 3. Open PWA, open console 4. In the console, enter next command: navigator.setAppBadge(2) and execute
ER: it sets badge with number "2" to the PWA icon
AR: it doesn't set anything, no errors in the console
# Problem Description The problem is almost not reproduced on most of devices (Macs), but for some rare users the PWA badge is not set for no reason.
We are using window.navigator.setAppBadge(unreadNotifications) for setting PWA badge. It works for 99% of users and we had no problem with it. But for some special cases, sometimes, for some users in the specific site it doesn't work. We have a user, which has a stable reproduce of this kind of error, and nothing helps to return badge back. Even more, on the other site (our inner pre-prod env) it works for him (and for all other sites too). Both sites have exactly the same docker images and configs - so manifest, SW and other things are same.
In order to fix or reproduce the problem we have tried to: - Manipulating with workers - deleting, updating, stopping - Disabling all Chrome extensions - Creating a clean Chrome profile - Restarting the Mac - Reinstalling the PWA several times - Exploring chrome://flags - Digging into Mac's system settings - Attempted to incorrectly install the PWA (unsuccessful) - Reviewed the documentation and potential issues - https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Badging_API - Reviewed current issues in Chrome - https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=setAppBadge&pli=1 - Disabling the manifest to prevent SW registrations - Turning off the internet/network
None of those steps helped with reproducing or fixing the problem.
I am out of ideas why this command doesn't work on exactly one site, but works for every other sites and the same site instance on the other domain. Please, if you know where should I investigate or what I could provide to understand the problem - please let me know.
Thank you!
# Summary navigator.setAppBadge(2) doesn't work, but returns Promise instead of error.
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: [Chromium GSoC] Request for Feedback (auto-testing)
entry.content:
**Questions Regarding Contribution to Touchscreen Automation Project**
I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to express my enthusiasm for contributing to the open-source community and my keen interest in the Touchscreen Automation Project outlined above. I am fully committed to dedicating my time and skills to see this project through to completion.
As I delve into the details of the project, I have a few questions that I hope you could kindly address:
1. As the project is focused on Chromebook testing, and I currently do not possess a Chromebook, would I still be able to contribute effectively? If so, what alternative methods would be available for testing my code without a Chromebook?
2. Could you provide more insights into Phase 1 as mentioned in the description? Understanding its specifics would greatly aid my understanding of the project's context.
3. The project description has left me with some confusion. Would it be possible to provide additional details to clarify the scope and requirements?
4. Is there already a satisfactory proposal or candidate for this project? I ask this to ensure that my efforts are aligned with the current needs and to avoid any unnecessary duplication of work.
I eagerly anticipate your response and am grateful for the opportunity to contribute to this impactful project. Thank you for considering my inquiries.

For graphics-related bugs, please copy/paste the contents of the about://gpu page at the end of this report.

entry.title: Postscript printing: Narrow image mask wrongly encoded
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open PDF with narrow image masks (< 7 pixels wide) 2. Print on a Postscript printer (PS Passthrough active)
# Problem Description Chrome will wrongly encode narrow image masks with a width of less than 7 pixels, or maybe if they are small in general. For those, it will not use CCITTFaxEncode like for larger image masks, but only ASCII85Encode. In the cases I saw, these were image masks in letters of fonts that use CharProcs where image masks are drawn, with a maximum width of 5 pixels, from 7 pixels on CCITTFaxEncode was used. Correctly encoded, each line of the bitmap should be one byte, e.g. for a width of 4 pixels, 4 bits for the image and 4 bits padding. Chrome, however, produces 4 bytes per line, with three extra 0 bytes. On the Canon and HP printers I tested, this leads to undefined errors when printing, as the printer exits from the filter in the mid of the stream and interprets the rest as Postscript command. Ghostscript does not run into an error, but displays the characters incorrectly (several horizontal lines).
# Additional Comments Attachments: reduced_decomp.pdf is a PDF with decompressed streams, created from a real PDF from a customer with all identifiable information removed. chrometest.ps is the Postscript created by Chrome from the PDF when printing to a PS driver with PS Passthrough.
# Summary Postscript printing: Narrow image mask wrongly encoded
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Bug - Software not working correctly
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Random App crashes happening when the loaded page in the webview starts communicating with our backend server
entry.content:
This template is for filing bugs against Android System WebView. Chrome bugs should be filed at https://crbug.com/wizard.
Android device name: Galaxy M32
Android OS version: 13
Android System WebView version: 121.0.6167.143
Application: under development
Application version: under development
Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to lobby 2. select a game template 3. It will launch new activity with webview in it. The webpages render UI and also make websocket connection to backend
Expected result: game should work normally with websocket messages send and recieved and UI updated
Actual result: webview crashes randomly with [0226/170239.923967:ERROR:socket.cc(182)] incorrect payload size 0 & lateron followed with complete App crash. This happens every 10-15 mins
Did this work before? Yes It was working till now for us. It started showing random crashes in the month of Feb 2024.
This issue is also observed in 121.0.6167.178 - Galaxy M12 - OS 13 - Here once the crash starts app will continue to crash 10-15 times and getting a popup to uninstall webview updates. Attaching screenshot for this
---
Attaching logs : In logs search for [0226/170239.923967:ERROR:socket.cc(182)] incorrect payload size 0 OR --------- beginning of crash

entry.title: [Issue Tracker Feedback] Adding hotlists after the creation
entry.content: It's hard to add a hotlist, like Chromium-Regression, after the fact. Trying to add that list to an existing bug, the hotlist search box doesn't find the hotlist. It only let's you create a new one. Adding the hotlist by id works, but that's so tedious.

entry.title: Chrome for Testing has a different Accessibility Tree comparing to the same version of Chrome
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open Accessibility Insights for Windows 2. Open Chrome for Testing 3. Open any website and focus any field 4. Check the Accessibility Tree
Expected Result: The Accessibility Tree of Chrome for Testing and Chrome should be identical
Actual Result: The Accessibility Tree of Chrome for Testing is different
# Problem Description Chrome for Testing has a different Accessibility Tree comparing to the same version of Chrome.
The root cause is the `UiaProvider` feature. When I run Chrome for Testing with the following parameters ` --disable-features=UiaProvider` - it works as intended.
Links: Accessibility Insights for Windows: https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/windows/overview/
# Summary Chrome for Testing has a different Accessibility Tree comparing to the same version of Chrome
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A
